column4: Why does the computer shut down when I try to burn a DVD-Video?
see if your logs reveal anything. this used to happen to me (overheat)
gnome may come with a graphical log viewer, see the menus.
I found the log file viewer. What do I look for that says my computer overheated?
specifically, look for the log entries at the time you shut down
None of the log files have "cpu" in them.
I found a log entry in syslog: "Critical temperature reached (102 C), shutting down."
That might be the problem, but when I set my computer down, I set it on a towel (don't ask why).
I set the computer on my desk chair which is very uncomfortable.  This is why I put towels on it.
i really don't know what effect that might have :)
I'm sorry.  I didn't know if that might absorb heat or something.
try leaving ample space for air to circulate
